channel.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
channel.description: how do u make the silabitems work correstly? i got them on my server but the only way i can get them i have to do "::item #####" how can i do "::pickup ###" and make them not equip as a wepon?

item.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
item.dc:creator: @God_Of_Legend God Of Legend
item.description:
@God_Of_Legend wrote:

To make them not equipt as a weapon go to Item4 and put the code in the place they belong, so say you have a cape the ID is 3146, go to Item4 and look for capes then add that ID with the rest then compile and run and its fixed

item.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Doesn’t have to do with dodian though,

It’s the command split.

Read full topic
item.source: How do u work silabitems correctly

item.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
item.dc:creator: @delta delta
item.description:
@delta wrote:

Or use the dodian(woot) one where you don’t have to type 0 in front of the id you can just type
::pickup 995 1
::pickup 91053 1
::pickup 1 1

    if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 1) {
	        String[] args = command.split(" ");
         if(args.length == 3) {
		int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
		int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
		if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
			addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
		} else {
			sM("No such item.");
		}
	} else {
		sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
	}
    }

Read full topic
item.source: How do u work silabitems correctly

item.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

Replace your pickup command, with this one:

[code] if (command.startsWith(“pickup”)) {
try {
int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7, 12));
int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(13));

                if (newItemID <= 20000 && newItemID >= 0) {
                    addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
                } else {
                    sendMessage("Use YOUR EYES!");
                }
            } catch (Exception e) {
                sendMessage("You fail at typing");
            }
        }[/code]

Read full topic

Apparently your grammar is not.

clop88:

what? i said how do i fix that i do (ex.) “::pickup 15156 1” (darkbow) it says “Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pickup 0995 10” so i do ::item 15156 then it pops up under me i pickit up and ten i weild it then it goes to wepon slot…

Change from 10000 or whatever it might be to, 20000. Still got problems, post again.

As for the wrong slot, thats in item.java, you fix it.

item.title: How do u work silabitems correctly
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

What are these ‘silab items’ you speak of?

If using the ‘pickup’ command for the ID’s for 5 numbers, assuming it is set at 20000? You would type:

::pickup ##### amount

You would replace amount, well with the amount of that particular item you want.

Read full topic
